resources.string: Linear interpolation draws a line directly between points.

Cubic interpolation draws an 'S' shaped curve between two points. This is cubic spine, with the controls points set such that the slope of the path entering and exiting a point will be as close to 0 as possible while being monotonically increasing on the X-axis. Note that this currently affects the display of the line only, it does not affect interpolation of points for the purposes of correlation. Linear interpolation will be used.

StepEarly draws a continuous step function from one point to the next, where the interpolated data will rise or lower to the next datapoint immediately. If a graph is descending, this will appear as a step in the form of the letter 'L').
StepLate draws a continuous step function from one point to the next, where the interpolated data will retain the value of the previous datapoint until the next datapoint is encountered.
StepLate draws a continuous step function from one point to the next, where the interpolated data will rise or lower to the next point at the midpoint between data points.
